sense.name: change in control
sense.commentary: TAKEOVER[+event] A change in who rules a thing or place. Usually refers to governments.
sense.examples: The military takeover of the Peruvian government left a lot of people unhappy. Johnny and I pulled off a takeover of Sally's snow fort. The takeover occurred, as do most coup d'etats, with massive bloodshed and destruction.

sense.name: corporate change in control
sense.commentary: TAKEOVER[+event] Specifically refers to corporations. Change by sale or merger in a company's controlling interest.
sense.examples: Wal-Mart's takeover of the Lone Star General Store occurred last year. Intelli-Soft attempted a takeover of Microsoft, but it went horribly wrong.
